definitions: To come together again in order to continue fighting or working.
To improve or recover after a period of weakness or decline.
To organize or inspire a group of people to support a cause or take action.
To return a ball in sports (e.g., tennis, volleyball) by hitting it back and forth.
examples: The troops rallied after the initial attack.
The stock market rallied in the afternoon.
They rallied support for the new policy.
The players rallied for a long point.
